ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Certainly not! We created them from what they know full well.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Never so. We have created them from what they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: By no means! They know that which We have created them from.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: By no means! For they know very well out of what We have created them (The human being's naturally growing from a living germ, without discipline and good deeds will not result in virtue).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Never! We have indeed created them from a thing they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But no! Verily, We have created them out of that which they know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: By no means! Surely We have created them of what they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Not so; for We have created them of what they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, verily. Lo! We created them from what they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Certainly not! They know quite well out of what We created them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means! veriiy We! We have created them from that which they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Never! Indeed, We created them from what they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By no means! For We have created them out of the (base matter) they know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: No, that is not like that! Verily, We have created them out of that which they know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Not at all, for We have created them of what they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: No indeed! We created them from what they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:39] Nay! — meant to thwart their hopes of [entering] Paradise. Indeed We created them, as others, from what they know, from drops of sperm, and so one cannot hope for Paradise [merely] on account of this: one hopes for it by being God-fearing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay, verily. Lo! We created them) i.e. the disbelievers of Mecca (from what they know) i.e. a sperm drop.
